title.native: 結婚するって、本当ですか
title.romaji: Kekkon Suru tte, Hontou desu ka

description:
Takuya and Rika work at the same travel agency in Tokyo and are both happily introverted and single. But their company is opening a new branch in Alaska next year, and employees without a spouse will be recruited to work there. Desperate to avoid the move, and though they’ve hardly spoken before, they decide to fake an engagement. Can these quiet coworkers become a convincing couple?

(Source: Crunchyroll)

tags.name: Fake Relationship
tags.description: When two characters enter a fake relationship that mutually benefits one or both involved.

tags.name: Marriage
tags.description: Centers around marriage between two or more characters.

tags.name: Heterosexual
tags.description: Prominently features a romance between a man and a woman, not inherently sexual.

tags.name: Kuudere
tags.description: Prominently features a character who generally retains a cold, blunt and cynical exterior, but once one gets to know them, they have a very warm and loving interior.

tags.name: Work
tags.description: Centers around the activities of a certain occupation.

tags.name: Primarily Adult Cast
tags.description: Main cast is mostly composed of characters above a high school age.

tags.name: Office Lady
tags.description: Prominently features a female office worker or OL.

tags.name: Urban
tags.description: Partly or completely set in a city.

tags.name: Office
tags.description: Features people who work in a business office.

tags.name: Travel
tags.description: Centers around character(s) moving between places a significant distance apart.

tags.name: Rural
tags.description: Partly or completely set in the countryside.

tags.name: Outdoor Activities
tags.description: Centers around hiking, camping or other outdoor activities.

tags.name: LGBTQ+ Themes
tags.description: Prominently features characters or themes associated with the LGBTQ+ community, such as sexuality or gender identity.

node.description:
[Blog](http://blog.wakakitamiki.coolblog.jp/) | [Twitter](https://twitter.com/angelfrench)

He was the assistant of [Takemura Yuuji](https://anilist.co/staff/105722/Yuuji-Takemura). [Satou Satsuki](https://anilist.co/staff/123240/Satsuki-Satou) and [Nakanishi Hiroshi](https://anilist.co/staff/275475/Hiroshi-Nakanishi) were his assistants.

[Twitter](https://twitter.com/aho_boy)

Hiroshi Ikehata is a Japanese director, episode director and storyboard artist.

[Twitter](https://twitter.com/heichin26)

Kazuho Hyoudou is a Japanese anime screenwriter and light novel writer. Currently a freelancer. He graduated from the Department of Film and Visual Arts in Osaka University of Arts. He previously worked as a production manager at [Sunrise](https://anilist.co/studio/14/Sunrise). Later debuting as a screenwriter on [Shutsugeki! Machine Robo Rescue](https://anilist.co/anime/3098/Shutsugeki-Machine-Robo-Rescue/) in 2003. Since then, he has written scripts for several anime series. His more recent notable works include [Tonikaku Kawaii](https://anilist.co/anime/116267/TONIKAWA-Over-The-Moon-For-You/) and [ReLIFE](https://anilist.co/anime/21049/ReLIFE/)

He has also worked as a scenario writer on the Xenoblade Chronicles series of video games by [Nintendo](https://anilist.co/staff/280450/Nintendo)

__Notable works outside anime:__

- Xenoblade Chronicles X (Video Game, 2015) (Scenario)
- Xenoblade Chronicles 2 (Video Game, 2017) (Scenario)
- Xenoblade Chronicles 3 (Video Game, 2022) (Scenario)
__Aiko Yamagami__ is a Japanese color designer and digital painter.

__[Website](http://honeyworks.jp/) | [Blog (JP)](https://ameblo.jp/honeyworks828/) | [Twitter](https://twitter.com/HoneyWorks_828) | [YouTube](https://www.youtube.com/user/HoneyWorks56410) | [NicoNico](https://www.nicovideo.jp/user/59387)__ __Biography__ HoneyWorks, alternatively known as Haniwa, is a Japanese circle consisting mainly of the composers [Gom](https://anilist.co/staff/147280/Gom) and [shito](https://anilist.co/staff/147276/Shito), and the illustrator [Yamako](https://anilist.co/staff/119761/Yamako). The guitarist [Oji](https://anilist.co/staff/148135) (Kaizoku Ou), the illustrators Rocoru (in 2013) and [Mogelatte](https://anilist.co/staff/121589/Mogelatte), the video producer Ziro and the pianist [cake](https://anilist.co/staff/147555) (the latter three joining in May 2014) are also part of the group as support members. Later on they acquired the drummer Nakanishi in 2017. However, Rocoru graduated from the group in 2019. Some of their most popular songs include "Suki Kirai", "Hatsukoi no Ehon" and "Kokuhaku Yokou Renshuu". Their music style consists mostly of positive rocky songs. In January 2014 they had their first major debut, with the album "Zutto Maekara Suki Deshita.", which ranked in fourth place on Oricon. In May 2014, the start-up of "CHiCO with HoneyWorks" was announced. Sometime in early 2019, the circle began to include subunits: s×c, a duo comprised of shito and cake; and HoneyMonster, comprised of Gom (Kouto), cake, and Nakanishi. The circle also created a number of fictional idols, such as LIP×LIP and Dolce. In addition, ten light novels, based on the Confession Executive Committee Love Series songs "Kokuhaku Yokou Renshuu", "Yakimochi no Kotae", "Hatsukoi no Ehon", "Ima ni Suki Naru.", "Koi-Iro ni Sake", "Kinyoubi no Ohayou", "Heart no Shuchou", "Ijiwaru na Deai", "Boku ga Namae wo Yobu Hi", and "Daikirai na Hazu Datta." have been released so far. A short novella about the song "Watashi, Idol Sengen" was also included with a CHiCO with Honeyworks album. Light novels for HoneyWorks' other songs do exist as well; the Love and Hate Trilogy ("Nakimushi Kareshi", "Suki-Kirai", "Hajimari no Sayonara") and "Sekai wa Koi ni Ochiteiru" and its sequel "Koi no Chord" both received one.

[Twitter](https://twitter.com/HaKoniwalily) | [Website](https://hakoniwalily.jp/) | [Spotify](https://open.spotify.com/artist/2rsT3GtKdBr9qBYXEn8lEZ) | [YouTube](https://www.youtube.com/channel/UCYRSuz5cmJeSNnGB7jedITg) | [Deezer](https://www.deezer.com/us/artist/13639858)

A musical group. So far, the number of views on the videos in which they have sung together has surpassed 40 million.
As an independent band, they have released two full-length albums under the production of [HoneyWorks](https://anilist.co/staff/146863).

(Source: Official Site, translated, edited)

**Members:**
- [Hanon](https://anilist.co/staff/171911)
- Kotoha

[Instagram](https://www.instagram.com/lulihorta) | [Facebook](https://www.facebook.com/lulihorta)

Luísa Horta is a Brazilian actress, voice actress, and dubbing director.

__Non-Anime Roles:__
~!- Kirra Foster / Skye (Valorant)
- Female Protagonist (Tower of Fantasy)
- Savannah Miller (The Circle EUA)
- Mary Anne (2nd dub; The Baby-Sitters Club)
- Kira Yukimura (Sony's dub; Teen Wolf)
- Alicia (Stuck 2017)
- Liz Cheney (Vice)
- Oh Hui-Ji (A Love So Beautiful)
!~

[Instagram](https://Instagram.com/manuelaoriguella/) | [Twitter](https://twitter.com/manuoriguella) | [Facebook](https://www.facebook.com/manuela.o.ventura) | [Youtube](https://www.youtube.com/@manuelaoriguella4630) | [TikTok](https://www.tiktok.com/@manuoriguella)

Manuela Origuella Ventura is a Brazilian actress, voice actress, singer, comedian, and content creator.

__Non-Anime Roles:__
~!- Tina (Triviatopia)
!~
Nayeli Mendoza Adame is a Mexican voice actress. She's the daughter of Luis Alfonso Mendoza

[Twitter](https://twitter.com/Vany90mx) | [Instagram](https://doblaje.fandom.com/es/wiki/Vanessa_Olea)

Vanessa Olea Melo is a Mexican voice actress.
